## The European Union: A Simple Explanation

The European Union (EU) is a group of 27 countries in Europe working together like a federation and confederation. It has over 449 million people and a strong economy, producing about one-sixth of the world's total wealth.

The EU allows people, goods, services, and money to move freely between member countries. It shares common policies on things like trade, farming, and fishing. Most EU countries use the same currency, the euro.

The EU has its own laws and represents its members in international organizations. It was started in 1993 and has grown since then, with countries joining and more areas of cooperation.
